DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Sample Collection at Submission Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the status of the protocol used to procure this sample at the time the sample was submitted for this project.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Protocol Specimen Collection Timepoint Submission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDDP LUAD clinical form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 1/13/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the state of the study protocol at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of enrolling, enlisting, or adding individuals to a group.

Concepts.definition: The process of enrolling, enlisting, or adding individuals to a group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical study status designating the study has been stopped prematurely and will not resume. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

Concepts.definition: A clinical study status designating the study has been stopped prematurely and will not resume. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.: To stop a process by imposing a freeze on it.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
To stop a process by imposing a freeze on it.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

Concepts.definition: A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The process of enrolling, enlisting, or adding individuals to a group.:A clinical study status designating the study open to accrual.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The process of enrolling, enlisting, or adding individuals to a group.
A clinical study status designating the study open to accrual.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for TCGA CDDP LUAD clinical data form per request by K.Wildermuth. mc 1/13/16
